chess

Class Chessboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chessboard

  • public abstract class Chessboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    SebastianKoch This Class implements the Chessboard and all functions where Pieces interact with each other Functions: setup Chessboard, draw Chessboard, update Chessboard, reset Chessboard, mark Squares as threaded if they are, check for possible checks on Chessboard, ccheck for checkmate

      static Square[][] board

      static java.lang.Boolean checkWhite

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Boolean checkForCheckmate(int yP, int xP, int yK, int xK)
      Checking for checkmate
      static java.lang.Boolean checkForChecks()
      Checking if the black or white king is in check, if one of them is, the function returns true If one king is in check the checkForCheckmate() function will be invoked
      static void draw()
      Drawing the Chessboard, each pieces has an individual char (from unicode) which is displayed on the console, the empty squares have their own char as well
      static void generateThreatsOnChessboard()
      Marking squares as threatened if they are.
      static void reverse(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Resetting the chessboard to its last move
      static void setup()
      Setting up the Chessboard with all the pieces standing on it The Chessboard is 8x8
      static void update(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Updating the chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public static void setup()
        Setting up the Chessboard with all the pieces standing on it The Chessboard is 8x8

      • draw

        public static void draw()
        Drawing the Chessboard, each pieces has an individual char (from unicode) which is displayed on the console, the empty squares have their own char as well

      • update

        public static void update(int startX,
                          int startY,
                          int endX,
                          int endY)
                   throws ProgrammEndException
        Updating the chessboard. It changes pieces position and markes squares as threatened if they are. In the end the function chechs for cpossible checks
        Parameters:
        startY - y coordinate of piece
        startX - x coordinate of piece
        endY - y coordinate of target square
        endX - x coordinate of target square
        Throws:
        ProgrammEndException - if a checkmate occurs the exception ends the game

      • generateThreatsOnChessboard

        public static void generateThreatsOnChessboard()
        Marking squares as threatened if they are. A square can be threatened by the black pieces or the white ones or by both ones

      • checkForChecks

        public static java.lang.Boolean checkForChecks()
                                        throws ProgrammEndException
        Checking if the black or white king is in check, if one of them is, the function returns true If one king is in check the checkForCheckmate() function will be invoked
        Returns:
        true for check / false for no check
        Throws:
        ProgrammEndException - if a checkmate occurs the exception ends the game

      • checkForCheckmate

        public static java.lang.Boolean checkForCheckmate(int yP,
                                                  int xP,
                                                  int yK,
                                                  int xK)
        Checking for checkmate
        Parameters:
        yP - y coordinate of threat Piece
        xP - x cooridinate of threat Piece
        yK - y coordinate of threatened King
        xK - x coordinate of threatened King
        Returns:
        true for checkmate / false for no checkmate

      • reverse

        public static void reverse(int startX,
                           int startY,
                           int endX,
                           int endY)
        Resetting the chessboard to its last move
        Parameters:
        startY - y coordinate of piece
        startX - x coordinate of piece
        endY - y coordinate of target square
        endX - x coordinate of target square
